commit_message: Bug 311936 - clip region larger than target surface area causing performance problem. r=cworth, a=asa
Fix memory leak. Bug 296014, r+sr=roc, a=shaver
use a better hash function, bug 239358 (courtesy of brendan)
fix bloat of imap msg dbs when headers have been downloaded r=naving, sr=sspitzer 114487
Fixing bug 120901. Eliminating unnecessary QI call in XPCWrappedNative::GetNative(). r=<email>, sr=<email>
Use default sorting strategy for square products.
Update copy helper to use fast_memcpy.
Avoid unnecessary conversion from 32bit int to 64bit unsigned int
Improve multi-threading heuristic for matrix products with a small number of columns.
Accelerate inference period in op Cache method (#43857)
Fixing the DOM part of bug 257602. Don't bother looking for elements in the document by ID/NAME when resolving class names, or declaring variables. r+sr=<email>
Disable the security check in nsContentUtils::CanLoadImage() to see if that's what costs us 2% per yesterday.
bug #171053 (r=jst, sr=darin) load network image requests LOAD_BACKGROUND to avoid generating unnecessary notifications...
fix memory leak copying multiple messages to an imap folder from a different account, 213688, sr=mscott
Bug 194266: Removed extraneous Truncate() calls. r=smontagu, sr=jst
Don't recalculate the size of the vector each time through the loop. llvm-svn: 150436
Consilidate SmallPtrSet count() followed by insert() into a single insert(). llvm-svn: 162330
modern objective-c translator: insert couple of pragmas for optimization. // rdar://11079898 llvm-svn: 153145
Prefer StringRef::startswith to the strncmp/strlen contraption. This may be slightly more efficient and is definitely more readable. llvm-svn: 165217
Remove alignment requirement from VCVTSS2SD in folding tables. Reverting r171049. This instruction doesn't require alignment. llvm-svn: 171078
[Support/YAMLParser] Use rtrim on plain scalars. llvm-svn: 156787
Change the default number of registers to prevent unrolling on targets that dont have this hook. llvm-svn: 171489
Don't walk a linked list twice in the same function. On my machine this takes "clang -cc1" on a file with 10k repetitions of extern int no_such_variable; from 1.434s to 1.133s. llvm-svn: 168394
Make PreprocessorOptions::DetailedRecordIncludesNestedMacroExpansions false by default. Recording nested macro expansions is not useful, plus it fixes rdar://10893630 llvm-svn: 150995
Check if the two clang opaque type pointers are equal before doing anything more exhaustive comparison. llvm-svn: 154181
release memory per iteration
Optimize /points database query
Update players.cpp Local Hook Collision line updates every frame instead of every tick
Moved MapDServer from SimpleServer to ThreadedServer
RankOrdinal: small performance update
fixed: use the maxWidth and maxHeight passed into LoadTexture() in CJpegIO for faster image loading
fixed: stop calculating the framerate when m_iFrameRateLength hits 128, it's probably correct by then
[vtb] clear picture allocated flag after passing up cvbuffer ref, eliminates the repeat frame stutter when fast-forwarding
added: check for cancellation status while doing the (potentially) lengthy add-on updates in repositoryupdatejob this lead to long waits on exit. closes #12050
Fix memory leak in uni::init_final_perm
It is enough for the CallInst to have no uses to be made a tail call with a ret void; it doesn't need to have a void type.
skip dbg_value instructions

Tweak CrashRecoveryContext::GetCurrent() to return quickly if 'gCrsahRecoveryEnabled' is false. This avoids us needing to go to thread local storage for the performance sensitive case where we are compiling code.
DWARF: avoid unnecessary map lookups.
Micro-optimize GroupByComplexity.

Check if a path is already absolute before trying to make it so. The FileSystem::makeAbsolute function has been calculating the current working directory unconditionally, even when it is not needed. This calls down to llvm::sys::fs::current_path, which is relatively expensive because it stats two directories, regardless of whether those paths are already in the stat cache. The net effect is that when using the VFS, every stat during header search turns into three stats. With this change, we get back to a single stat for absolute directory paths.
don't calculate the index in hashMapInsert until it's needed
Use local IPC adapter instead of DBUS one if possible
dataman: Reduce stack to 1800, based on real usage of 800 bytes
fix a memory leak in XinZhan by Fsu0413
New tilemaps start with palette 0 if possible
Navigator RTL: run find_RTL_destination() only on_inactive
FIX: allocated too much memory, such that we were running out.
Minor optimization (pointed out by cachegrind).
Use raw_svector_ostream for string concatenation.
Removed scaling from the umeyama when it is not requested.

[PCH] In ASTReader::completeVisibleDeclsMap, after we loaded all visible decls, mark the declaration context as not having external visible storage any more. This should improve performance as we won't needlessly reload the visible decls multiple times and seems to fix the i386 crash in rdar://11327522.
stm32h7:px4io_serial use TRBUFF - includes NuttX with TRBUFF backports

Bug 816656 - Don't write the startup cache on shutdown. r=taras The startup cache will be saved in the background ~10 seconds after startup. If 10 seconds haven't elapsed yet don't bother write the cache on shutdown.
Updating the YouTubeAPI class. Updating it to eliminate an "unnecessary-spinning" bug.
osd: skip osdmap version query if we can If we get OSDmaps from the mon we *also* learn the oldest/newest map epochs; no need to query again.
In AliMUONTriggerQAChecker: Fixing memory leak (bug report #85154)

[Modules] Don't compute a modules cache path if we're not using modules! Notably, this prevents us from doing *tons* of work to compute the modules hash, including trying to read a darwin specific plist file off of the system. There is a lot that needs cleaning up below this layer too.
Replaced QDict<void> by StringUnorderedSet used to keep track of visited paths
BitstreamWriter: Use SmallVector::append instead of multiple push_back calls.
[libcalamares] Enlarge unpackfs to 12x
Minor efficiency tweak, suggested by Patrick Meredith
cleanup: skip performing unnecessary copy construction
avoid copying ModuleSpec in getModuleSpec() by returning a reference to it instead of returning a full object.
mavlink: Removed static buffers where no static buffers where necessary
-> Multires Editmode fix Typo in Multires Editmode integration meant that way too much memory was getting allocated for a pointer array (more than 10 times as much).
librbd: removing a "pessimizing move" Silencing a compiler warning ("warning: moving a temporary object prevents copy elision")
Reimplement DefineTypeSize in terms of APInt. This eliminates some magic integer arithmetic and allows it to work with types larger than 64 bits.
GUI: Use native file selectors Apparently fixes a freeze in some Windows version when the "Browse" or "Add Files" buttons are clicked.

Subcompaction boundary keys should not terminate after an empty level Summary: Now we skip to add boundary keys to subcompaction candidates since we see an empty level. This makes subcompaction almost disabled for universal compaction. We should consider all files instead. Test Plan: Run existing tests. Reviewers: IslamAbdelRahman, andrewkr, yhchiang Reviewed By: yhchiang Subscribers: leveldb, dhruba Differential Revision: <url>
minor refactoring to improve compile-time performance.
Fix addrinfo memory leak in platform mode Detected with LSAN
Fix memory leak in Browser::get_selected()

[runtime] Don't add slack capacity to StringTable shrink Since we now add the additional required capacity when assessing StringTable shrinking during LookupKey-caused string insertion, we no longer have to add a slack capacity. This more closely matches previous behaviour, which didn't consider the additional required capacity but did add slack (which, because of rounding to the next power of two, amounts to the same thing). Bug: chromium:1108258 Reviewed-on: <url> Auto-Submit: Leszek Swirski <<email>> Commit-Queue: Camillo Bruni <<email>> Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/master@{#69127}
Optimization suggested by Matthijs Kooijman.

Like the comment says, prefer to use the implicit add done by [r+r] addressing modes than emitting an explicit add and using a base of r0. This implements Regression/CodeGen/PowerPC/mem-rr-addr-mode.ll
Early stop: retire redundant Rml.size() == 1 case In case there is only 1 legal move we will stop the search at depth 10 anyway because the exclusion search probe will fail low. No functional change.

In SCEVAddExpr::get, skip over any cast operands before looking for nested add operands after constant operands. The recent change to recognize sign-extend expressions caused this to be exposed more often.

Avoid double-traversing for QualifiedTypeLoc -- we were calling VisitTypeLoc twice for qualified types, once for the qualified form and once for the unqualified (though they looked the same by the time we got to visittypeloc). Now only visit once, which matches previous behavior. Reviewed by nlewycky llvm-svn: 107754
GPencil: Fix memory leak in previous commit
Added an option to have the PBQP allocator attempt coalescing during allocation.
rpc: remove cs_main lock from `createrawtransaction` This is a pure utility function that doesn't use main's data structures, so it does not require that lock.

boost::remove from string operations Summary: boost::iequals is Expensive and decreases IPC because std::locale is involved. Reviewed By: mjoras Differential Revision: D21918171 fbshipit-source-id: 6cec27a1af9f510942e1ab3267d7cc088dae9ba2
Do one map lookup instead of two.
Fix use of uninitialized variable causing kbdd to go haywire and chew up 100% CPU. Bug introduced in 7.4.0 #714. Bug identified in #1337.
IPRA: avoid double query to the map (NFC) llvm-svn: 275689
Do not request hover image update if correlations are frozen
don't need to reload textures on mode change anymore
Change PUCCH fake signal in LteUePhy from full bandwidth to null bandwidth
Remove a couple more cases of "getNumUses() == 0". No need to walk the linked list just to see if whether the list is empty.
kern: fix unnecessarily strong load in aligned spinlock Copy-paste error I didn't notice for two years, whoops
Fix tiny memory leak in fluid (setting scheme) Also initialize 'scheme_name' to make static code analyzer happy.

Reserve two in-object properties slots for JSErrors The most common use-case for creating errors is "new Error('message')". The resulting JSError object has two properties. The message passed to the constructor and an accessor for the stack. This CL reserves two in-object property slots for these two, so no PropertyArray has to be created. Bug: v8:9116 Reviewed-on: <url> Commit-Queue: Simon ZÃ¼nd <<email>> Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/master@{#60791}
[turbofan] Ship TF for dynamic lookup slots. R=<email> BUG=v8:4131 LOG=N Review URL: <url> Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/master@{#28753}

Check if subscription to remote endpoint already exists before emplace Summary: In case we have multiple instances of DSFNode object pointing to the same remote endpoint (e.g. MTIA), the current logic would endup creating a temporary DsfSubscription object, only to delete it just after. This is not great as it will create unnecessary session churn. Note that emplace does not guarantee that a new object will not be created in face of key already existing. Reviewed By: zechengh09 Differential Revision: D60981460 Privacy Context Container: L1125642 fbshipit-source-id: e8753c14a8f37b9a74e71c9fe087ec02647661a5

For performance, don't initialize SparseRep data array to 0. * Sparse.h (SparseRep (octave_idx_type nr, octave_idx_type nc, octave_idx_type nz = 0)): Don't use aggregate initialization of array d. It is not necessary since valid elements are controlled by r and c indices and will be set when an actual value is assigned.
TAP_Win32: Use vector assign instead of resize + memcpy
Skip unneeded sort changes
tsan: faster memory reset for Go llvm-svn: 168567
Minor hsv2rgb speedup on ARM.
[d3d11] Enable shaderStorageImageMultisample if the device supports it

Don't add same light to area many times. Note that there is outer loop by all lights when they are added to areas. So if we have finished with some light, we will never try to add it again. The only case when duplication happens is when light reaches same area through portals by many ways.
fixed runaway memory alloc bug on 64-bit in ParseString found by sirius-m
QThreadPool: use swap() when making a copy of allThreads This is the C++98 version of std::move().

Allow forcing single-threaded execution at runtime. Summary: Might be useful for the EXC_RESOURCE / CPU issues. Reviewed By: salexspb Differential Revision: D4565494 fbshipit-source-id: 74ac9edeba6334a46ee6799a93ca96eb68216439
[Codechange] Improves the efficiency of the multi-threaded inter truck collision code. Related to: #220

r600g/sb: fix value::is_fixed() This prevents unnecessary (and wrong) register allocation in the scheduler for preloaded values in fixed registers. Fixes interpolation-mixed.shader_test on rv770 (and probably on all other pre-evergreen chips). Tested-by: Andreas Boll <<email>>

Only run aktualizr-repo tests with ed25519 They used to be run with all key types, including big RSA. This was our longest running test, despite testing one of our less critical piece of code. Let's just use the fastest key type we have.
Force texture memory to get freed by moving statement.
Change of phase for single sample fix
commit on behalf of abela: xft speed improvement
sys/dev/fsl/usb2-udc: invalidate buffers before DMA transfer
refactor(smp): speed up seek
Fix memory leaks Thanks spumer
dri/nouveau: Split big client buffers in the indexed case too.
mesa: Fix memory leak on error path. Fixes Coverity resource leak defect.

Exit early from unionFindWithingEachDistanceCell to avoid bounds check trigger When Kokkos is compiled with Kokkos_ENABLE_DEBUG_BOUNDS_CHECK=ON, examples/dbscan reports ``` 1: Kokkos::RangePolicy bounds error: The lower bound (1) is greater than the upper bound (0). ``` This is coming from this function, where RangePolicy starts at 1. This is a minor change to exit early. An additional benefit is not launching the kernel when n == 0.
Remove redundant clearColorBuffer from Blit

Performance: don't call WinHttpGetProxyForUrl for a file URL (e.g. from webkit) That method can be slow, since it does a DHCP query followed by a DNS query (sometimes followed by a Netbios query, too)... no point in doing it for every file URL loaded in webkit. Merge-request: 1128
GRIM: Fix a memory leak in "SetShadow::loadBinary"
gpu: jit: conv: do not use prefetch with SLM k-slicing

[webgui] use --single-process process when run chrome in headless mode While here chrome used only with JSROOT, one could test that ROOT code runs properly with such setting. Should improve performance and startup problems on 32bit debian
Optimize global func Sign. New version is between 10% and 50% faster!
remove duplicated calculation of length
We only do always-inlining at -O1; make opt reflect that. llvm-svn: 132693
Petty optimization. llvm-svn: 113049
SLPVectorizer: Speedup isConsecutive by manually checking GEPs with multiple indices. This brings the compile time of the SLP-Vectorizer to about 2.5% of OPT for my testcase. llvm-svn: 186592

#ue4 - Tighten tolerance on rotation changes in CharacterMovement when determing if the object we stand on has rotated. Picks up slower rotation rates at higher framerates. [CL 2613244 by Zak Middleton in Main branch]
